identifiedFish.name: Clownfish
identifiedFish.habitat: Warm tropical reefs, often associated with sea anemones
identifiedFish.geographicalRange: Indo-Pacific region, including the Red Sea and Australian coast
identifiedFish.distinctiveFeatures: Bright orange with white stripes, mutualistic relationship with sea anemones

tankRequirements.diet: Omnivorous, including algae, plankton, and small crustaceans

identifiedFish.behavior: Generally peaceful but can be territorial, especially towards other clownfish
identifiedFish.specialCareInstructions: Requires anemone for optimal health and behavior, sensitive to water quality
identifiedFish.interestingFacts: Clownfish are protandrous hermaphrodites, meaning they can change gender from male to female.
